content.question: Let <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be a function with derivatives of all orders. If <math alttext="P sub 3, of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is the third-degree Taylor polynomial for <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> about <math alttext="x equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></math>, which of the following statements about <math alttext="P sub 3, of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> must be true?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub 3, triple prime, of 0, equals f triple prime of 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="P sub 3, triple prime, of 0, equals, the fraction with numerator f triple prime of 0, and denominator 3 factorial, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>!</mo></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

One of the terms of <math alttext="P sub 3, of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is <math alttext="the fraction x squared, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>.
